metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2546 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
sound/core/timer.c in the Linux kernel before 4.4.1 uses an incorrect type of mutex, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (race condition, use-after-free, and system crash) via a crafted ioctl call. Dmitry Vyukov discovered race conditions in the Advanced Linux Sound Architecture (ALSA) framework's timer ioctls leading to a use-after-free. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2546` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
